content: If you return, O Israel,
if you remove your abominations from my presence,
and if you swear, “As the  lives!”
then nations shall be blessed by him,
For thus says the  to the people of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
Break up your fallow ground,
Circumcise yourselves to the ,
or else my wrath will go forth like fire,
Invasion and Desolation of Judah Threatened
Declare in Judah, and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say:
Blow the trumpet through the land;
“Gather together, and let us go
Raise a standard toward Zion,
for I am bringing evil from the north,
A lion has gone up from its thicket,
to make your land a waste;
Because of this put on sackcloth,
“The fierce anger of the
On that day, says the , courage shall fail the king and the officials; the priests shall be appalled and the prophets astounded.
Then I said, “Ah, Lord , how utterly you have deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘It shall be well with you,’ even while the sword is at the throat!”
At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem: A hot wind comes from me out of the bare heights in the desert toward my poor people, not to winnow or cleanse—
a wind too strong for that. Now it is I who speak in judgment against them.
Look! He comes up like clouds,
his horses are swifter than eagles—
O Jerusalem, wash your heart clean of wickedness
How long shall your evil schemes
For a voice declares from Dan
Tell the nations, “Here they are!”
“Besiegers come from a distant land;
They have closed in around her like watchers of a field,
Your ways and your doings
This is your doom; how bitter it is!
Sorrow for a Doomed Nation
My anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain!
My heart is beating wildly;
for I hear the sound of the trumpet,
Disaster overtakes disaster,
Suddenly my tents are destroyed,
How long must I see the standard,
“For my people are foolish,
they are stupid children,
They are skilled in doing evil,
For thus says the : The whole land shall be a desolation; yet I will not make a full end.
Because of this the earth shall mourn,
for I have spoken, I have purposed;
